screenshots.screenshot:
Crystal structure of an H/ACA box RNP from Pyrococcus furiosus (PDB CODE: 2HVY)
Cbf5p Gar1 Nop10 L7AE RNA
A nucleotide of the RNA helix is flipped out into the active site formed by the protein complex.
(submitted by Wayne Decatur)

Biotin (cpk color, spacefilled) inside its binding pocket in a streptavidin subunit (cyan translucent surface) and capped by a portion of the neighbour streptavidin subunit (yellow translucent surface).
(submitted by Angel Herraez)
A fragment of transcription factor TFIIIA forming three consecutive zinc finger motifs (cartoons), bound to a stretch of DNA (spacefilled). (submitted by Angel Herraez)
Highlighting two salt bridges in hemoglobin tetramer (hemo group as sticks at bottom-right). (submitted by Angel Herraez)
Periodic table showing atomic, van der Waals and ionic radii for all elements with their unique colors. (submitted by Angel Herraez)
A frame of an SN2 reaction animation with the distance measured between the chlorine and carbon atoms
Vibration animation of methanol with vectors displayed.
Display of bounding box and axes of coordinates space. Note the transparency of the yellow halo around selected atoms.
Hemoglobin with backbone trace colored by chain and spacefilled hemes. This image taken from the pre-release development version of Jmol v10.
Acetic acid using CPK colors and spacefilled atoms. This image taken from the pre-release development version of Jmol v10.
A few residues with backbone in blue and vdw dots surface. This image taken from the pre-release development version of Jmol v10.
